title: The tikv component triggers the alarm type = "unreachable" when reloading
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
v4.0.12

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->
x86
### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
case1:
tiup cluster reload dba-test -R tikv  --transfer-timeout 1
![LQucGq04v9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63033738/164404734-cdb12add-52a5-47ec-86da-cc64d71ec36f.jpg)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63033738/164404869-89a1ce46-92e4-4352-96df-ad84caf171f3.png)


case2:
tiup cluster reload dba-test -R tikv  --transfer-timeout 100000
![uU87vNq7YR](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63033738/164405163-866e2807-351a-405c-a199-0fe97acf0a5c.jpg)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63033738/164405500-3851e732-7c82-4fec-acc2-081caf54fbf2.png)


### What did you expect?
Do not trigger alarm type = "unreachable"


### What did happened?
a lot of "sum(rate(tikv_server_report_failure_msg_total{type=#unreachable#}[10m])) BY (store_id) > 10‚Äù

comments_data.body: I think this is expected, restarting TiKV is supposed to abort connection.
